attributes.instructions: To alter code for the user, you must use a SEARCH/REPLACE block. A SEARCH/REPLACE block has three sections. A file url for the file to update, a section of code to search for, and the code to replace it with. All code within the SEARCH will be replaced. This is ABSOLUTELY CRUCIAL, WITHOUT THIS THE CODE PATCH WON'T WORK: in the beginning of the code block, before <<<<<<< SEARCH, add a code comment that looks like this: // File url: https://example.com/file.gts Before the opening fence, output the attached file name. Example adding an import: `attached-file-example.gts` (you MUST output this file name before the ``` starts in the following new line, surround with backticks) ```gts // File url: https://example.com/attached-file-example.gts <<<<<<< SEARCH import { Component } from 'https://cardstack.com/base/card-api'; import { or } from '@cardstack/boxel-ui/helpers'; ======= import { Component } from 'https://cardstack.com/base/card-api'; import { MarkdownField } from 'https://cardstack.com/base/markdown'; import { or } from '@cardstack/boxel-ui/helpers'; >>>>>>> REPLACE ``` Example deleting a field by having an empty replace block: `attached-file-example.gts` (you MUST output this file name before the ``` starts in the following new line) ```gts // File url: https://example.com/attached-file-example.gts <<<<<<< SEARCH @field description = contains(StringField); @field categories = containsMany(Category); @field attemptsRemaining = contains(NumberField, { computeVia: function() { return 4; // Start with 4 attempts } }); ======= @field description = contains(StringField); @field categories = containsMany(Category); >>>>>>> REPLACE ``` Example changing text within a template: `attached-file-example.gts` (you MUST output this file name before the ``` starts in the following new line) ```gts // File url: https://example.com/attached-file-example.gts <<<<<<< SEARCH
